title: Inbox folder moved on Thunderbird 102.9.0 (Linux)
content: I have been using Thunderbird for a long time without and major problems. Now.. my Inbox folder was moved to another folder, I may have fat fingered that... I don't see any way to make the new Inbox the email folder or to move the old Inbox into its place.
creator: normscherer

title: Why is the time in Thunderbird's calendar different from the system time?
content:
Since april 2, system time (Ubuntu 20.04.02) and Thunderbird's time are not synced, but they are configured at the same time zone: "América/Ciudad de México" (GMT -6). Thunderbird (102.9.1) is taking the obsolete daylight saving in Mexico, which is not applied since this 2023.

That is affecting event notifications, they appear set as if they were created in another time zone.

Screenshots attached were taken at same hour.
creator: leoperbo

title: I keep getting a request to allow TBird to access my Google account ...
content:
It's the calendar !!!!!!

There is no hint why TB is popping up the giant login screen, it's also as big as hell, you need a 4k display to see the whole window and as it turns out, it was because of the google calendar! I had no google account in TB, took me a while to figure it out what the hell is happening.

User experience -100.
creator: ncq1

title: Thunderbird message downloads
content: My Thunderbird does not seem to want to download messages from frontier.com today. It says that the host is contacted and it is sending login information, and nothing more happens. I can reach frontier.com directly by Mozilla (or Safari on my iPad), but Thunderbird seems to have gone dead. What can I do?

title: Launching TB
content:
I am using a used HDD that has 2 accounts - each has its own APPDATA file. One account belongs to the old computer where the HDD came from, and the 2nd acct was moved from my primary acct. that was on a different HDD. Should I just move any files I might want from the 1st Account, then delete it?

When I tried to launch TB, I rec'd this error message: "Your Thunderbird profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible." I'm not 100% confident I have all the needed files in the Thunderbird Appdata folder. Can you tell me the names of the files I need?

If I just delete any existing APPDATA files (while keeping the Profile Folders) would TB just create a set of new APPDATA files - and then I could move the appropriate Profile Names to where it belongs? Thanks...
